subject: Computer Science
title: Java Primitive Types
description: Understanding the basic types and structures of Java is where new programmers should start. This set of notes will cover the basic data types in Java. Java is a statically-typed language, which means that all variables must first be declared before they can be used. This involves stating the variable's type and name.
objectives: Understand the basic data types in Java
Understand the difference between similar data types
Understand the importance of data types in programming
prerequisites: Basic exposure to other programming languages
